  <script type="text/javascript">
    $(document).ready(function() {
      window.lazySizesConfig = window.lazySizesConfig || {};
      window.lazySizesConfig.preloadAfterLoad = true;
      $('.navbar').css('position', 'initial');
      $(document).on('click', '#nav_currencies', function(e) {
        $.ajax({
          type: "GET",
          dataType: "html",
          url: "/ajax_currencies.php",
          success: function(d) {
            $('#currencies_content').html(d);
          }
        });
      });
      $(".openbtn").on("click", function() {
        $("#mySidepanel").slideDown();
        $("body").css("overflow-y", "hidden");
      });
      $(".closebtn").on("click", function() {
        $("#mySidepanel").slideUp();
        $("body").css("overflow-y", "scroll");
      });
    });
  </script>

<!-- End Google Tag Manager --></head>

================================================== -->

  <div class="container main_page_container" style="padding-bottom:60px; max-width:700px;">

    <ol class="breadcrumb">
      <li class="breadcrumb-item"><a href="/">Travelmyth</a></li>
      <li class="breadcrumb-item active">
        Privacy      </li>
    </ol>

    
      <div class="page_container">
        
    <h1>Travelmyth Privacy Policy</h1>
    <p>By using Travelmyth Platforms you agree to this Privacy Policy, the <a href="/terms">Terms & Conditions</a> and the <a href="/cookies">Cookies Policy</a>. Please check them frequently as they might change without notice.
    </p>
    <p>Whenever a change applies on the Terms and Conditions or on this Privacy Policy, if you're a member, you will see a notification on the Website. Any use of Travelmyth Platforms after such notification shall constitute your approval of the new Terms and Conditions and the new Privacy Policy.</p>
    <p>Travelmyth is a hotel search engine and hotel reservation provider. Registration on Travelmyth is strictly voluntary and free and is only necessary to reach some features like saving your favourite hotels.</p>
    <h2>Collected Information</h2>
    <p>We collect data in three ways:</p>

    <h3>Information you choose to provide us</h3>
    <p>
    When you're performing a search you provide us information like the dates of travel, the destination, the chosen categories and filters used like the price range.
    </p><p>When you're browsing our sites you provide us information on which pages you choose to visit and your preferred language and currency. 
    </p><p>When you click a link to a booking site we collect this information. 
    </p><p>When you create a member account you provide us your email, first name and last name. We also ask you to choose a password and if you agree to receive marketing emails from us. Your registration is complete when you confirm your email. Any information that you give us must be true, current and accurate.
    </p><p>When you start or complete a booking on Travelmyth you provide us your name, email, phone number, country of passport, special comments as well as your preferred room type, the number of persons travelling, the number of children travelling with you and their ages as well as any special requests you might have. For fraud prevention you might need to send us your identity card or passport. After the booking you might send us feedback and information about your experience at the hotel.
    </p><p>If you're making a booking on behalf of someone else or you're providing personal details of others that you're travelling with, it's your responsibility to get their consent before you provide their details and make sure that they understand how their data will be used according to this Privacy Policy.
    </p><p>When you contact us through a contact form, a support ticket, a social media message, by email or phone you provide us your name and contact details and you write a message which might include additional personal information that you choose to provide, for example your CV if you're applying for a job.
    </p>

    <h3>Information we collect automatically</h3>
    <p> 
    When you visit a page or perform a search, we collect information like your IP address, the date and time of your visit, the referring URL, the exit URL, the dates of your travel, the number of persons travelling and the number of children and their ages, the selected destinations and hotel categories, as well as information about the browser and the device that you use to access our Platforms. From your IP address we try to detect your country. We need this information to serve you with relevant content, detect malfunctions and improve your experience.
    </p>

    <h3>Information we receive from third parties</h3>
    <p>When you complete a booking at a Booking Site that you were redirected through our Platforms, the Booking Site might inform us about the dates of your booking, the hotel, your country, your language, your device, the purpose of your travel (business/leisure) and the fee that will be paid to the Booking Site by the hotel.
    </p><p>When you're redirected to our bank to pay for a booking that Travelmyth acts as the OTA, the bank will inform us the payment was completed successfully or not, your name, card type and first and last digits of your card, expiration date and other related details. We only store on our servers the status of the payment (successful or failed).
    </p><p>We use Google Analytics for statistics and this service anonymously saves information like your country, your browser version and screen resolution. For more information about the data stored through Google Analytics, please visit our Travelmyth Cookies Policy.
    </p>

    <h2>Data Retention</h2>

    <p>If you complete a booking on our Platforms, we need to keep your personal data in order to provide the service and for tax, legal and auditing purposes. Usually, we'll not need to keep your data after we receive a tax clearance certificate for the tax year that your booking was placed.
    </p><p>If you have a member account, we keep your data for as long as you have the account. You have the right to ask us to delete your personal data if we don't have any overriding legal obligation to retain certain data.
    </p><p>If you're using our Platforms without having an account, we might keep your activity linked to an IP address indefinitely to protect our business interests and improve our product by being able for example to verify whether our Terms & Conditions are being complied with, to enhance network security, to prevent fraud, to understand how users interact with our product and to inform our marketing strategy.
    </p>

    <h2>Data Processing</h2>

    <p>Data Processing takes place according to all applicable Greek and European laws and regulations and the Data Controller (Travelmyth Private Company, Githiou 22, Chalandri 152 31, Greece) has filed the necessary Notification to the Greek Data Protection Authority.</p>
    <p>Purpose of this Processing is in principle the provision of our services to you, as described in our website. Provided that you register as a Travelmyth member and therefore consent to these terms, we may also evalate or analyze your personal preferences, in order to create a personal profile for marketing purposes. This means that while using Travelmyth Services you might get personalized search results or any other information related to your preferences. If we have your consent, we might send you personalized offers by email from time to time.</p>

    <h2>Data Transfer</h2>

    <p>Well never sell your personal information to anyone, with an exception in the event that Travelmyth is sold itself, which will mean that everything will be transferred to the buyers so that they can continue to provide the services.</p>
    <p>When you complete a booking on our Platforms we'll transfer relevant reservation details to our contracted suppliers (hotel rooms wholesalers / bed banks / hotels) in order to perform the booking contract.</p>
    <p>When you choose to get redirected to another Booking Site to continue your search there, we'll share your dates of travel, the number of rooms, adults and children and their ages and the selected hotel in order to get redirected to the correct page at the Booking Site.</p>
    <p>Well share your personal information with authorities if required by law or court order or asked by authorized law enforcement personnel.</p>
    <p>From time to time we might also share aggregated usage information with others or publicly, like the most popular searches for example. This type of information will not contain any personally identifiable information.</p>
    <p>We use third party processors who provide us various services that require to have access to elements of your personal data, such as:
    <ul>
        <li>payment processing services</li>
        <li>sending email services</li>
        <li>data analysis services</li>
        <li>customer care platforms</li>
        <li>marketing assistance services</li>
        <li>security and fraud prevention services</li>
        <li>providers of hosting and IT security services</li>
        <li>providers of accounting services</li>
    </ul>
    </p>

    <h2>Data Security</h2>
    <p>Your personal data is safely stored in a server within the EU (Germany), where industry-standard security technologies are used. However, no organization in the world can eliminate security risks.<br>
    Access to your personal information might have our employees and contractors only if they need it to carry out their work and third-party service providers who work on behalf of or with us, exclusively in order to provide some of the services and features of Travelmyth Platforms and to be able to offer you customer support.<br>
    In case of a breach we'll notify the Greek Data Protection Authority and if your data rights and freedoms are at risk, we'll notify you as well.
    </p>

    <h2>Social Media</h2>
    <h3>Facebook</h3>
    <p>On Travelmyth Platforms we have links to Facebook. By clicking these buttons, a connection is automatically created through your browser to the Facebook servers and the company Facebook receives the relevant information. If you are logged in to Facebook while visiting our Platforms or have saved cookies from Facebook in your browser during a visit to our site, Facebook can recognize your visit to our site and possibly show your activities on your Facebook profle. You can prevent this from happening by logging out of Facebook before you use our Platforms and by deleting the Facebook cookies in your browser. For more information about the use of other websites in connection to Facebook, read carefully the terms and conditions and privacy policy of Facebook.</p>
    <h3>Google</h3>
    <p>On Travelmyth Platforms we have links to Google+. By clicking these buttons, a connection is automatically created through your browser to the Google servers and the company Google receives the relevant information. If you are logged in to Google+ while visiting our Platforms or have saved cookies from Google in your browser during a visit to our site, Google can recognize your visit to our site and possibly show your activities on your Google+ profile. You can prevent this from happening by logging out of Google+ before you visit our site and by deleting the Google cookies in yor browser. For more information about the use of other websites in connection to Google and Google+, read carefully the terms and conditions and privacy policy of Google and Google+.</p>

    <h2>Protecting Minors</h2>
    <p>Travelmyth does not knowingly collect Personal Data from minors and removes such information from its records when notified accordingly.</p>

    <h2>Your Rights</h2>
    <p>You have the right to free information about your saved personal data, the right to correction, the right to withdraw consent, the right to restrict processing, the right to data portability, the right to object usage and the right to deletion. Sign in to your member account and go to the "My Account" page to find all settings and possibilities. If you need to contact us, you can use our contact form or send a registered letter to the Data Controller:<br>
    Travelmyth Private Company<br>
    Githiou 22<br>Chalandri 152 31<br>Greece</p>

    <p>Revised 23 May 2018</p>

      </div>

    

  </div>

                        <div class="col-md-3 col-sm-4 col-6" style="padding:10px;">
                <span class="bg-vg" style="display:inline-block"></span>&nbsp;
                <p class="card_box" style="font-weight:600;font-size:13px;display:inline;"><a href="https://www.travelmyth.com/British-Virgin-Islands/Hotels" class="travelmyth-choice-link" target="_blank" title="British Virgin Islands">British Virgin Islands</a></p>
            </div>

    if ($(window).width() < 768 && $(window).width() > 565) {
      $('.hotel_searches').removeClass('col-xs-6');
      $('.hotel_searches').addClass('col-xs-4');
    }
    if ($(window).width() <= 565) {
      $('.hotel_searches').addClass('col-xs-6');
      $('.hotel_searches').removeClass('col-xs-4');
    }
    $(".tablinks").click(function() {
      tab_id = $(this).attr('id');
      $(".tablinks").removeClass("active");
      $("#" + tab_id).addClass("active");
      $(".tabcontent").hide();
      $("#" + tab_id + "_tab").show();
    });
  </script>

    .tab button {
      background-color: inherit;
      float: left;
      border: none;
      outline: none;
      cursor: pointer;
      padding: 14px 16px;
      transition: 0.3s;
      font-size: 18px;
      width: max-content;
    }

    /* Change background color of buttons on hover */
    .tab button:hover {
      background-color: #74ADEB;
    }

    /* Create an active/current tablink class */
    .tab button.active {
      background-color: #38487E;
      color: white;
    }

    /* Style the tab content */
    .tabcontent {
      display: none;
      padding: 6px 12px;
      margin-bottom: 20px;
      max-height: 470px;
      overflow-y: scroll;
      border: 1px solid lightgrey;
      background-color: #F0F8FF;
      font-family: "Roboto", sans-serif !important;
    }

    #world_tab.tabcontent {
      display: block;
    }

    .scrollLinks,
    .tabcontent,
    .continents {
      scrollbar-width: thin;
    }

    .scrollLinks::-webkit-scrollbar,
    .tabcontent::-webkit-scrollbar,
    .continents::-webkit-scrollbar {
      width: 5px;
      height: 5px;
    }

    .scrollLinks::-webkit-scrollbar-track,
    .tabcontent::-webkit-scrollbar-track,
    .continents::-webkit-scrollbar-track {
      background: #f1f1f1;
      border-radius: 10px;
    }

    .scrollLinks::-webkit-scrollbar-thumb,
    .tabcontent::-webkit-scrollbar-thumb,
    .continents::-webkit-scrollbar-thumb {
      background: #888;
      border-radius: 10px;
    }

    .scrollLinks::-webkit-scrollbar-thumb:hover,
    .tabcontent::-webkit-scrollbar-thumb:hover,
    .continents::-webkit-scrollbar-thumb:hover {
      background: #555;
    }

    @media (max-width: 767px) {
      h1 {
        font-size: 24px;
      }
    }

    /*burger menu*/
    .sidepanel {
      display: none;
      width: 100%;
      position: fixed;
      z-index: 3;
      top: 0;
      left: 0;
      bottom: 0;
      background-color: white;
      overflow: hidden;
      height: 100vh;
      max-height: 100vh;
    }

    .sidepanel a {
      padding: 10px 8px 8px 20px;
      text-decoration: none;
      font-size: 18px;
      color: #38487E;
      display: block;
      transition: 0.3s;
      text-align: left;
      border-bottom: 1px solid rgba(0, 0, 0, .1);
    }

    .sidepanel .closebtn {
      position: absolute;
      transition: 0.3s;
      color: #38487E;
      cursor: pointer;
      top: -10px;
      right: 25px;
      font-size: 36px;
    }

    /* .openbtn {
    font-size: 26px;
    line-height:26px;

    cursor: pointer;
    color: black;
    border: none;
} */

   }
    .navbar{

    /*end of burger menu*/
  </style>
</body>
